intro: Scleria motleyi var. densispicata, commonly known as the dense-bracted sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with three stamens and a single pistil. Scleria motleyi var. densispicata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks.
